Would you say your disposable income (i.e., money after rent, car payment, utilities, groceries, etc.) each month is...
Survey of 1,000 U.S. adults ages 33 to 40 conducted from February 12 to 15, 2021.
Would you say you are living "paycheck to paycheck" (i.e., you run out of money before your next paycheck)...
Survey of 1,000 U.S. adults ages 33 to 40 conducted from February 12 to 15, 2021.

PayScale
Deviation from wealth expectations
This figure compares the median family wealth held by Millennials born in the 1980s with wealth expectations set by all generations of families of the same race or ethnicity at similar ages.
Federal Reserve Board's Survey of Consumer Finances via the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis
